Posts.Content: Shirl wrote: Onc found lump in same breast as previous DCIS cancer.  MRI, P.E.T., and Blood Work all ok.  Should I just relax and be thankful? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump...Scar Tissue? Shirl runalot08

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2009 01:29PM Shirl wrote: No, I had a lumpectomy.  I got my MRI results back and it was also clear.  They said it's just scar tissue.
Posts.Title: Lump...Scar Tissue? Shirl runalot08

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2008 06:51PM Shirl wrote: I had basically the same diagnosis as you.  I was diagnosed last year at 50 and pre-menopausal.  I did lumpectomy and radiation.  The radiation was not that bad and my surgeon said the lumpectomy along with radiation was as effective as masectomy in my case.  I tried tamoxofen for 6 months and couldn't stand the side effects.   My onc said he was ok with me getting off of it with the type of cancer I had.  It's hard to know what to do.  You want guidance but they seem to leave the decisions up to us.
Posts.Title: Rads for low-grade DCIS redheadace1 fullofquestions

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2008 04:47PM - edited Aug 7, 2008 04:48PM by Shirl I was diagnosed with BC and my surgeon ordered a P.E.T. Scan.  A tumor was found on my thyroid which was also cancer.  They said they were unrelated and that I just got a double wammy.  The surgery was not to bad and I only stayed over night.  The worse for me was waiting for my TSH level to get low enough for treatment.  Just really tired.  I had a pill and had to keep my distance from people for about a week and not let anyone use my bathroom because of the radioactive.  I have a scar that most people don't even notice.
Posts.Title: Thyroid Cancer snufflesmom Shirl

Posts.Content: Shirl wrote: Had 0 Stage DCIS and Thryroid Cancer in 2007 with clear margins and clear lympnodes.  Had lumpectomy and radiation.  A lump was found this week in the same breast and I'm waiting for results of P.E.T. Scan.  I was told this could possibly be scar tissue.  Anyone else had this experience? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: DCIS/Possible 2nd diagnosis Shirl Beesie

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2008 04:10PM Shirl wrote: I also had severe pain in my left ovary.  I was diagnosed with bc and thyroid cancer last year.  After starting on the tamoxophen, the pain went away but then I've had to deal with other side effects of the meds.   Hopefully, they will get better.  Please, keep that fighting spirit.  You can win this battle!
